Good Software

Heres a growing list of software, services, and products that I use and like.

Software

  • gentoo - a flexible GNU/Linux or BSD distribution
  • archlinux - a lightweight and flexible GNU/Linux distribution
  • freebsd - advanced computer operating system
  • openbsd - a free multi-platform UNIX-like operating system
  • xmonad - the tiling window manager that rocks
  • evince - simply a document viewer
  • bumblebee - a project aiming to support NVIDIA Optimus technology under Linux
  • tmux - a terminal multiplexer
  • tmate - instant terminal sharing
  • zsh - a shell designed for interactive use
  • urxvt - our extended virtual terminal
  • kubernetes - production-grade cluster orchestration
  • bitlbee - an IRC to other chat networks gateway
  • irssi - modular realtime chat client
  • mosh - the mobile shell
  • plan9 - a research system developed at Bell Labs
  • vim - the editor
  • emacs - a free/libre text editor
  • mtr - advanced traceroute
  • nmap - the network mapper
  • hakyll - a static site generator
  • loblib - a TeX package for creating lobster themed documents

Services

  • tarsnap - online backups for the truly paranoid
  • backblaze - cloud storage
  • rescuetime - time tracking software for productivity

Products

  • synology - network attached storage done well
